definition: to retail/to sell individually or in small quantities

zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)

sentences.english: The developer claims that this game has been a top-seller on wireless and on retail platforms.
sentences.chinese: 开发商声称，这场比赛已顶级无线和卖方的零售平台。

sentences.english: Constructing service chain is a necessity for the development of the Chinese retailing industry.
sentences.chinese: 构建服务链战略是中国零售业发展的必然选择。

sentences.english: Yarn of cellulose acetate filaments, single, nes, not put up.
sentences.chinese: 其他单纱，醋酸纤维长丝纺制，非供零售用。

sentences.english: It's little surprise then that there's not much incentive for retailers and e-tailers to challenge the status quo.
sentences.chinese: 零售商和网售商挑战出新的动机不大，一点也不奇怪。

sentences.english: Food retailers have cashed in on this opportunity with zeal.
sentences.chinese: 食品零售商怀着热情利用了这一商机。

sentences.english: His father apprenticed him to a linen draper.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲把他送去跟亚麻织品零售商当学徒。

sentences.english: Buying Times will help Lotte increase scale in China, which is critical in such a competitive market.
sentences.chinese: 购买时代零售将有助于乐天百货扩大在华业务规模。

sentences.english: Already this year the growth rate in rural retail sales has outpaced that in the cities.
sentences.chinese: 今年，农村零售销售增长率已经超过了城市的销售率。

sentences.english: PC companies have dabbled in retail with varying results.
sentences.chinese: PC公司都涉猎了零售，但结果各不相同。

sentences.english: Liebmann. "Retailers are going to have to work very hard to create that emotional feeling again."
sentences.chinese: 零售商正努力再创造出这种动人的感觉。

sentences.english: For several years he was Watkins' top retail salesman.
sentences.chinese: 他连着几年都是沃特金斯公司的最佳零售推销员。

sentences.english: Tellingly, the Bailian Group, China’s biggest retailer, is state-owned.
sentences.chinese: 比如说中国最大的零售企业上海百联集团就是国企。

sentences.english: Some of the Asian vendors are hardly household names.
sentences.chinese: 其中一些亚洲零售商几乎名不经传。

sentences.english: Many retailers offer online deals for Black Friday.
sentences.chinese: 很多零售商人会在耶稣受难日提供网上交易。

sentences.english: He set up shop as a retail tobacconist in the High Street.
sentences.chinese: 他在哈艾大街开业做烟草零售商。

sentences.english: And in retail, music devices are different from plasma TVs.
sentences.chinese: 而在零售业，音响设备不同于等离子电视。

definition: e-commerce (abbr. for 電子商務|电子商务[dian4 zi3 shang1 wu4])/(old) to negotiate by telegram or telephone
fresh produce and freshly prepared foods
Ali Baba, character from The Arabian Nights
market/store/mall (usually specializing in a particular product category such as furniture)
